text: Dark phrases of womanhood, of never having been a girl. Half-note scattered without rhythm. INT. JUANITA’S APARTMENT — DAY 2 JUANITA a nurse dressed in green and relentless volunteer stands in the kitchen of her modest apartment watering a plant. She goes back to her table where she has several hundred flyers printed. The flyers read, “Free Clinic Seminars on Thursday”.

No tune distraught. Laughter fallin’ over a black girl's shoulders. It’s funny. It’s hysterical. The melodylessness of her dance. Don’t tell nobody, don’t tell a soul. She’s dancing on beer cans and shingles.

INT. JOANNA’S APARTMENT - DAY 3 JOANNA a high powered business woman stands in her posh penthouse apartment high above Manhattan, she is getting ready for work. Dressed in red, she stands in her closet. Her husband CARL, in silhouette is in the shower. We see him in the distance. (CONTINUED)
Joanna picks his pants up off the floor, a card falls out. She picks the card up and looks at it, then puts it back in his pocket.
This must be the spook house. Another song with no singers, lyrics no voices and uninterrupted solos, unseen performances. Are we ghouls? Children of horror?

INT. ALICE’S APARTMENT - DAY 4 ALICE a religious fanatic walks to a closet in her small run down apartment. She sits in her closet and starts praying. She’s dressed in all white, lighting candles on a makeshift altar.

The joke? Don’t tell nobody, don’t tell a soul. Are we animals? Have we gone crazy? INT. KELLY’S APARTMENT -— DAY 5 KELLY, an overworked social worker, is looking at a pregnancy test stick in the bathroom of her modest apartment. It’s negative. She is dressed in blue. DONALD her husband enters. She quickly puts it in the trash can and tries to hide her frustration. He kisses her.
I can’t hear anything but maddening screams and the soft strains of death. And you promised me. You promised somebody. Anybody. Sing a black girl's song.

A graduation is in full swing. We see NYLA dressed in purple, as she receives her diploma. Her mother ALICE beams with pride from the front row. Alice is dressed in all white with a cross on and a huge bible. Her older sister TANGIE dressed in orange looks uninterested as she looks at a one of the male teachers making eyes at her. (CONTINUED)
Bring her out to know herself. To know you, but sing her rhythms caring, struggle.

Hard times sing. Her song of life. She’s been dead so long, closed in silence so long. INT. CRYSTAL’S APARTMENT — DAY 7 CRYSTAL lays in the bed in a very run down apartment BEAU WILLIE is having sex with her. Her brown dress is pushed up above her thighs. A tear rolls down her face.

She doesn’t know the sound of her own voice, her infinite beauty. She’s half-note scattered without rhythm, no tune. Sing her sighs... Sing the song of her possibilities. Sing a righteous gospel. Let her be born. Let her be born and handled warmly.
And this is for colored girls who have considered suicide but moved to the ends of their own rainbows.

INT. TANGIE’S APARTMENT —- KITCHEN - DAY 8 Tangie sits at the kitchen table of her small urban apartment. She is writing in her journal. She takes some orange butterflies out of her hair and put them in a box. A half-dressed man comes out of the bedroom. We realize that it’s the same man that she was making eyes with at the graduation.
You got anything to eat?
You’‘1l have to go now. I've got lot of work to do and I can’t with aman around. She walks over and gives him his pants. (CONTINUED)
Here are your pants. There’s coffee on the stove. It’s been very nice but I can’t see you again.
What did you say to me?
You got what you came for. Didn’t you? He mumbles as he puts on his pants.
I couldn’t possibly wake up with a strange man in my bed.
Is that why you been out here all night.
Why don’t you go home. I’m sure your wife is looking for you. He glares at her for a second.
Yeah, okay. He walks out and slams the door.

Yes, get your little dick, no fucking ass, out of here. EXT. CRYSTAL’S APARTMENT BUILDING - DAY 9 Man # 1 walks out the apartment building. Juanita opens the back door of her car. She is trying to remove a plant from her backseat. Kelly stands at the door on the intercom.
Hello.
Yes.
Hi, I’m Kelly Watkins from Child Welfare. (CONTINUED)
10 GOLDENROD REVISED 5.
What can I do for you?
I’m looking for Crystal Wallace.
What do you want with her?
I don’t have time to play these games Ms. Wallace. Open the door or I’m coming back with the police.
Kelly is buzzed into the apartment building.
Hold it please. Kelly holds the door.
Thank you.
INT. CRYSTAL’S APARTMENT BUILDING - HALLWAY - DAY 10 Kelly enters. She looks for the elevator.
Great. Kelly walks to the stairway and looks up. Crystal looks down from the fifth floor.
No elevator?
It’s a walk up. Kelly starts the walk up the stairs. She passes Juanita holding the plant and standing at a doorway.
I know you’re in there Frank. Open the door. She looks down at the bottom of the door seal. (CONTINUED )
10 11 GOLDENROD REVISED 6.

You got a woman in there? Franklin. You know what...Fine Frank. Fine, I’ve had enough of this, I'm sick of your shit and Without any assistance or guidance from you I have loved you assiduously for eight months, two weeks and a day. I have been stood up four times. I’ve left seven packages on your doorstep, forty poems, two plants and three handmade note cards. And I left town so I could send them. You have been no help to me on my job. You call at 3:00 in the morning on weekdays. Charming, charming. But you are of no assistance. I want you to know this was an experiment to see how selfish I could be. If I could really carry on, to snare a possible lover. If I was capable of defacing myself for the love of another. If I could stand not being wanted when I wanted to be wanted. And, I cannot so, with no further assistance and no guidance from you. I am ending this affair. She reaches into her purse and takes a note card. She sticks it into the plant.

There’s a note that is attached to a plant I've been watering since the day I met you. You may water it your damn self. INT. CRYSTAL’S APARTMENT BUILDING - HALLWAY - DAY 11 Gilda comes out of her apartment.
Good morning.
Good morning.
Is somebody coming up?
You know somebody coming up Ms. Gilda. (CONTINUED)
11 GOLDENROD REVISED 7.
Who is it? Crystal gives her a look. She hears a noise coming from her apartment.
Is that Beau Willie? Crystal gives her a look.
Can you get my mail when you go downstairs?
Sure I’ll get it. Apartment 515 door opens Tangie sweeps dust into the hallway.
You’re gonna clean that up.
It's dust. It will blow away.
Everything don’t blow like you. You got a lot of men coming through your house.
Why you jealous cause you don’t have no men COMING at all. Mind your business. Tangie turns to go into her apartment.
Your old ass better leave me alone. You have been the bain of my existence since they voted you apartment manager. Tangie goes into the house and slams the door.
I can’t stand that girl. Just a tramp.
I’‘1l talk to you later Ms. Gilda. Kelly makes her way to the fifth floor. (CONTINUED )
11 12 GOLDENROD REVISED 8.
Oh, okay. Gilda goes into her apartment. She slowly closes the door.
I gotta start exercising.
You just did. Kelly is breathing hard. CRYSTAL (CONT’D) Can I get you some water?
Please. Crystal goes into her apartment. Kelly follows.
INT. CRYSTAL’S APARTMENT — DAY 12
I told the doctor that she was fine. It’s just a little bruise. Kelly looks around the small but neat apartment. Crystal gives her a glass of water.

Thank you. I understand that but, any time a child is repeatedly seen in an emergency room, we have to do a home visit. Where are your children? Crystal goes into the small bedroom. Kelly sees cigarette smoke and feet hanging from a bed in the bedroom. She can hear a very loud TV. Crystal comes out with the kids and closes the door.
Is that the children's father?
Yes. Kelly looks at the kids. (CONTINUED)
I’‘1l need to speak to him.
He’s asleep.
You must be Kenya. Hello. The kids don't respond.
My name is Kelly. I like your shirt. Can you talk to me for a second? Do you remember when you went to see the doctor the other day? How did you hurt yourself? Beau Willie comes out of the room.
Who is this?
I’m Kelly Watkins from Child Welfare.
Child welfare?
Yes.

Damn Government. I called them months ago to get veterans benefits. I can’t get a case worker. How the fuck the government gonna send you down here about some kids? I been asking them bastards. I defended this damn country, so you can have that job, and they send you down here with this bullshit. Get the fuck out of here. Coming here about some damn kids. Sensing she is not safe Kelly quickly gathers her things INT. CRYSTAL’S APARTMENT BUILDING - HALLWAY - DAY 13 Crystal quickly closes the door. Kelly looks at the kids as the door is closing. Gilda opens the door. (CONTINUED)
(whispering) It ain't her that’s hurting them kids. It’s him. I baby sit ‘em, I know. I can hear everything through this wall. That's why I called you.
You called.

Yes. She can’t protect them from him. Ever since he came back from the war he’s been crazy. And he drinks like a fish. Do her a favor take them children. He came home crazy as hell and tried to get veterans benefits to go to school & they kept right on puttin’ him in remedial classes. He couldln’t read wortha damn, so Beau cussed the teachers of holdin him back & got himself a gypsy cab to drive, but his cab kept breakin down and the cops was always messin wit him. Crystal went and got pregnant again and Beau most beat her to death when she told him, she still gotta scar under her right tit where he cut her up. Still Crystal went right on and had the baby, so now Beau Willie has two children, a and there waz no air. Beau Willie opens the door. Gilda quickly closes her door. Kelly walks down the stairs. She can almost feel Beau Willie staring at her. She looks back at Beau Willie. She hurries out. INT. CRYSTAL’S APARTMENT BUILDING - HALLWAY - DAY 14 Alice walks up the stairs past Kelly. She knocks on Tangie’s door. Tangie opens it.
What?!
I need some money.
For what? (CONTINUED)
Things.
I gave you money on the first.
There are things I need.
Like what?
Do you know how hard it is for me to come over here and ask you for anything? (CONTINUED)
Then stop doing it.
I wouldn't, if I didn't have to.
What do you need money for?
You do this to taunt me. You are just as evil as my father was. Just evil.
Granddaddy put me in charge of his little will because he knew you would give all of it to that cult.
It’s not a cult. You would know that if you came and spent some time at the Temple of Elohim.
I'm not giving you any money.
You will burn in hell child.
Why is it when I give you money I’m blessed of Elohim and when I don't I'm going to burn in hell?

I pray for you that you find God through the mist of the distances that Satan has put in your heart. He has lured you to him through deception, through the dark forces. Don’t let them take your body. Tangie starts closing the door.
Repent! Repent!
Bla, Bla, Bla, Bye Alice. (CONTINUED)
14 15 GOLDENROD REVISED 12.
She closes the door. Alice exits towards the stairs.
EXT. CRYSTAL’S APARTMENT BUILDING - DAY 15 Alice comes out of the apartment building and walks down the street handing out “Jesus Saves” tracks.
Praise Elohim. People ignore her. Yasmine and Bill pass her.
Repent children. Yasmine takes a track.
God bless you.
Thank you. Alice looks at her. Then she looks at Bill.
Are you ready to meet Elohim.
I'm straight lady, thanks. She looks at Yasmine.
Be careful of the dark seekers. He’s darkness. Just evil. She gives her a dollar.
The golden city awaits you. Alice walks down the street.
You just bought your way out of hell.
I guess I did. (CONTINUED)
Anyway, go on you were talking about your girls.
It’s so great. You should meet some of them they have so much hope. And they’re getting that from dance.
Look how your face lights up when you talk about them.
I know, they excite me. You know most of my kids graduate from high school and go on to college.
That's great. He looks at her for a second.
What?
Everyday since I met you two weeks ago we walk this route. I go to work, you go to your dance class and you never answer my question.
Bill I told you.
Do you know how much courage it took for me to step to you ona crowded subway. Come on.
I just got out of a bad relationship.
I'm not trying to marry you. I just want to take you out to dinner.
I'm going to be late for my class.
See. So that’s how you are. (CONTINUED)
15 16 GOLDENROD REVISED 14.
What?
You’re one of those women that will only give. You won’t let people give to you.
Ok, dinner tomorrow night.
8 o'clock tonight.
Ok. See ya tonight. The two go in different directions on the street.
It's going to be great.
INT. COMMUNITY CENTER - YASMINE’S DANCE STUDIO - DAY 16 Nyla is in a dance class with eight other girls. The girls are doing their warm-ups.

It was graduation night and I was the only virgin in the crowd. Bobby Mills, Martin, Jerome, Sammy Yates, Eddie Jones and Randy. All cousins. They pick me up ina black Buick. Smelling of alcohol and ladies in heat. We rambled from Camden to Mount Holly laughing at the afternoon's speeches. Our tassels dangling from the rear view mirror. Nyla stretches.

Climbing different sort of project stairs. We went to a party and I got drunk and couldn't figure out whose hand was on my thigh. But it didn’t matter because these cousins, Martin, Eddie, Sammy, Jerome and Bobby was my sweethearts alternately since the seventh grade. (CONTINUED)
16 Nyla and the other girls stretch. And dance about. All the girls seem to be listening.

The party got crazy so me and Bobby left the party before the police came. We were in the backseat of his old Buick. And girl Bobby started looking at me. Yeah, he started looking at me real strange. Like I was a woman or something and started talking real soft in the backseat. By the time the sun was coming up I couldn't stop smiling. Yasmine walks in.
You gave it up in a Buick?
You better be talking about a ride to school.
Yes we were.
Have you done your warm ups?
Yes.
Great. Are you ready to begin. The girls say yes.
Positions, from one. And two, and three and again. Nyla and spin. Nyla runs out of the room and onto the street.
Keep doing your warm up girls.
She follows her out to the street.
Are you ok? (CONTINUED)
17 18 19 GOLDENROD REVISED 16.
Yeah, I'm just nauseous. I don't know what it is.
I think you’re just nervous about college and being on your own. I’ve seen this before. You’1l be fine. You're a smart girl. Come on I’‘1l get you a ginger ale. They walk and almost bump into Donald.
Excuse me.
He gets into his police car with Renee.
Coffee.
Thanks. Donald drives off.
Renee sits next to him drinking coffee.
Who can understand women?
You tell me.
But you're a woman.
No, I'm a woman and I date women. And I don't have any answers.
What good is having a lesbian to ride around with all day if you can’t give me some insight on the female mind from a same sex point of view. (CONTINUED)
19 20 GOLDENROD REVISED 17.
That's not fair I helped you get out of the dog, house when you forgot your anniversary didn't I? Renee sees a car in an alley.
Yes you did.
Thank you. Hey stop, back up. They see a BMW parked in an alleyway with the windows steamed up.
That's a really nice car for this neighborhood.
Yep.
The two officers walk up to the car on opposite sides and tap the glass.
Get out of the car. Two men get out of the car buckling their pants.
You’re under arrest.
For what?
Indecent exposure.
We weren't doing...
I saw you sir.
Yeah and unfortunately I did too. (CONTINUED)
You have the right to remain silent.
Wait, wait...Look I can’t go to jail.
Then, you should have gotten a room.
Any needles in your pockets? Donald walks Carl to the back seat of the squad car.
Children take this route home from school all the time.

Juanita sits in the lobby waiting area of the very upscale building. It is very modern and very cold with lots of hard edges and upright uncomfortable furniture. Katina an assistant comes out of an office.
Is she ready to see me?
I’m sorry, it'll be just a few more minutes. She goes to a table and pours a cup of coffee.
Where is Crystal?
She called. She’s on her way.
Does it take this long to get tea? Katina quickly pours the coffee out and quickly makes tea as Juanita looks on.
I’ve got it right here. I’m sorry she'll be right with you. (CONTINUED)
21 22 GOLDENROD REVISED 19.
Honey, I’m the one that’s sorry for you. Katina runs into the office.

INT. BRADMORE PUBLICATIONS - JOANNA’S OFFICE - DAY 22 Joanna sits in a large office behind a glass desk it seems as if all of Manhattan is the view from both sides of the office windows. She sits talking to four people.
I don’t understand this. This is a magazine not a web-site. Joanna clears her throat. Katina hands her some tea.

The readers want texture. Look at this ad, it says nothing. You all need to go back to the drawing board. Bring me something with style, contour. Ok, thank you. Four people exit the meeting. Joanna has a small cough. Crystal runs in.
Finally, you’re here. What happened this time? One of the children had a fever, the baby- sitter was late or you over slept.
I’m sorry.
I do have limits even for a very good assistant.
Yes ma’am.
Where is the buy Katina?
It's here. I left it on your desk I knew you would need it this morning. (CONTINUED)
And the st...
The stat report is attached. Also your nine o'clock is here.
What nine o'clock? She looks at her watch.
It’s ten.
Last week you agreed to meet with Juanita Sims. She runs a nonprofit organization. Shall I send her in.
Fine. Katina goes out to get her.
Oh, why do I take these beggar meetings. Juanita comes in as Katina and Crystal leave out.
Hi. Juanita Simms.
Hi. What can I do for you?

I’m so glad that you took this meeting. I’1l be quick because I know you're really busy. I was reading in your magazine about your upbringing and I just knew... Joanna seems to not be paying attention to her.

You would respond to this program. I’m a nurse and I started a free health and wellness clinic ina community center in one of the poorest neighborhoods in this city. As you know growing up poor like so many of us. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

We never had health care or even talked about it. So I just wanted to educate women on their bodies and at the same time their mind and souls. You and me both were raised by single mothers so I know how that is.
That's great. Where do I come in? Juanita hands Joanna a flyer, placing it on top of the document that she was distracted with. The two woman look at each other oddly for a second.
Well this is just a little nonprofit. And everything I've been doing, I've been doing on my own, out of my pocket, you know we get a small donation here and there.
Let me stop you, I give to Cancer, I give to Education, I give to Africa. Those are my charities of choice.
And those are all great causes but there is so much need right here in our own community.

Our community, I think that we've all been afforded the same opportunities in this country and if these women, these people didn't do anything with their opportunities, it’s not my issue. I’m afraid I’m going to have to say no. Thank you.
Thank you? Joanna leans into the intercom.
Crystal see Ms. Sims out please. Crystal comes in. (CONTINUED)
Did she just...
Right this way please.

No. I sat in this damn lobby waiting an hour for you. Cool, you don’t want to give us any money I get that. But this attitude and disregard for people’s time and feeling is ridiculous. Does it take all of this for you to be that? Cause if it does, you might be paying too much. Juanita walks out.
Donald stands in the room Kelly paces a little. The doctor comes in.
Babe will you stop pacing.
I'm sorry.
It’s ok.
What if he says we can’t have children?
Baby that wouldn't be the end of the world.
I want to give you a child, Donald.
Hello.
Hi. (CONTINUED)
Hi.
Ok, so we got the lab results and the test results. He puts up an x-ray.
This is why your haven't been able to conceive. Your fallopian tubes are scarred. We usually see this form when a pelvis infection that wasn't treated.
What wasn't treated?
Oh, should we speak alone.
No, its fine.
An untreated STD can cause this issue. Donald looks at her.
What about surgery?
I honestly wouldn't recommend it. It's risky, you could end up needing to have a hysterotomy. Kelly walks out of the room.
I’m sorry.
Thank you.
Hey. (CONTINUED)
24 25 GOLDENROD REVISED 24.
I’m sorry I just need to go to work.
It’s ok baby.
You know how hard it is looking at all of these people who don't want children, I gotta go to work.
Ok I’1l see you at home later. He kisses her.
I love you.
I love you too.
The hotel is very trendy and new, likened to the W hotel franchise. The bar is a small area filled with people. Tangie is the bartender pouring drinks.
Let me have a double shot of vodka straight. She smiles.
What?
You can tell a lot about a man by what he drinks.
Oh yeah?

Yeah, that man over there is drinking a beer. He's broke, now the guy over there is drinking champagne trying to impress the lady but he doesn't know what a good bottle is so he bought the most expensive. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)
He laughs. GOLDENROD REVISED 25. 25
The two guys over there are drinking from glasses with umbrellas. They are so flaming if they walk past a sprinkler it will go off.
Oh yeah. What does my drink say about me?
It says you're married, here on business and want to get a buzz quickly so you can have a good time and forget about the wife at home.
Wow?
Am I right?
Dead on. So what are my chances.
For what?
Having a good time in your beautiful city.
Looking very good daddy.
And just where can I go to have a good time?
Tell you what, I’m off in a few hours I could show you around if you're up for it.
I'd like that very much.
Tangie there is a black woman in the lobby who says she’s your mother. She won’t come in because this is a bar and of the devil. (CONTINUED)
25 26 GOLDENROD REVISED 26.
Cover me. She goes out to the lobby of the nice hotel.
What are you doing at my damn job?
I need some money.
I told you I wasn't giving you any money now get out of here.
I need three hundred and eighty five dollars.
For what?
I just need it.
Get out of here Alice.
I have to have the patience of Job to deal with you, my daughter. You’re going to end up in the belly of the whale if you don't get your life right.
Security! A security guard walks over.
This customer has had too much to drink can you escort her out.
Ma’am would you come with us please. (CONTINUED)
26 27 GOLDENROD REVISED 27.
You touch me I will bless you out with this oil, child boy.
INT. CRYSTAL’S APARTMENT - NIGHT 27 Crystal reads a bedtime story to the kids. Beau Willie comes in.
Hey.
Hey. I kept the dinner warm for you.
Yeah ok.
How did it go?
What are you talking about.
I thought you were going to try to look for a job today.
Ain't nobody trying to hire a veteran. Get me a drink. She gets him some water. He knocks it out of her hand.
What the shit is that?
Water.
I want a drink.
Beau maybe you shouldn't drink tonight.
You trying to say I got a problem. (CONTINUED)
No, I’m saying you shouldn't drink tonight.
So you telling me what I should do now.
I'm telling you what I think. I'm not accusing you of anything. Are you hungry?
I'm not an alcoholic.
I know that.
I'm trying Crystal.

I know that too, Beau. It’s just that you get so mad sometimes. I know the army did you wrong. I saw it. I'm on your side. I know why you get mad but baby when you drink you get out of control. So don't drink tonight do it for me. Ok.
Ok. You know I love you?
I know.
You love me.
Of course I do.
Then why wont you marry me.
We got more things to worry about then getting married.
If you loved me you would. (CONTINUED)
I love you. Now come on and get some dinner in you. He gets up and goes to the kitchen. 29. 27
INT. COMMUNITY CENTER - JUANITA’S FREE CLINIC - DAY 28 Juanita is talking to several women.

Ladies, these condoms are free. How many times have you heard your man say, “It don't feel the same” or “I ain't got nothing” when his ass ain't even been to a doctor. Make him use them. If you know how many young beautiful faces I see every day like yours at the hospital cause they didn't want to hurt the mans feelings. Shhhittt, hurt his feelings or let him go home hurting. Frank taps on glass in the door. Juanita looks at him.
Excuse me, I’1l be right back. Juanita goes out the hallway.
Hey, baby.
I don't want to talk to you. I haven't seen or heard from you in four days.
Baby, you know I drive that truck.
Don't give me that bullshit. I know you. Were you with her?
Baby, I miss you. 29 (CONTINUED)

You miss me when she get tired of you. I'm to old for this Frank.
I love you.
No, you don't.
Yes I do.
If you really love me, then leave me alone.
Don't hurt me like this.
Hurt you. Get out of here Frank. I got these ladies to talk to. Juanita goes back into the classroom as Frank looks at her. INT. COMMUNITY CENTER - JUANITA’S FREE CLINIC - DAY 30
When you use a condom it is important that you use a water based lubricant....
Joanna sits at the table dialing on the phone. There is no answer.

Look I know we had a fight the other night but this silent treatment is not good for me. You were suppose to meet me at dinner. Call me. I’m starting to worry. We find Bill and Yasmine in the restaurant.
My papa thought he was Puerto Rican & we would have been except we were just regular Negros wit hints of Spanish. (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

So off I made it to this 36 hour marathon dance con salsa con Ricardo ‘Suggggggggggar’ Ray on southern boulevard. It was up up up up up stairs and stairs and lotsa hallway wit my colored New Jersey self. Didn’t know what anybody was saying except if dancin waz proof of origin I was jibarita herself that nite. I kept smilin and right on steppin. If he could lead I waz ready to dance. If he couldn't lead I caught this attitude. I'd seen Rosa do and would not be bothered I waz twirlin hippin givin much quick feet and bein a mute cute colored Puerto Rican. Bill laughs. As we pan over to Joanna.
Are you ready to order?
You know Danny I think I'm going to go home. Can you have my driver pull around please.
Sure.
Thank you. INT. ALICE’S APARTMENT - EVENING 32 Nyla is cooking dinner. Alice walks in and sits down.
Hey mamma.
Angel.
I know you’re tired.
I am.
Come on. (CONTINUED)
Nyla kneels down and takes off Alice's shoes.
Thank you. My sweet baby. You are nothing like your sister. Here. She gives her some money. Nyla looks at it.
This is only thirty-eight dollars.
I know. I tried to get more but your sister wouldn't give it to me.
Maybe you shouldn't have told her it was for me.

I didn't tell her what it was for, but you know I wasn't going to lie. You know she can’t stand you. You've always been so much better then her. If she knew that it was for you to better yourself she would never give it to me. Your sister is so wicked. She holds that wallet like its Jacob holding on to an angel.
Why did grandpa put her in charge of the money when he died?

To nail me to the cross. That's why he only gives me a thousand dollars a month. He wants to keep his foot on my neck even in death. Don't you worry I'1l figure out something. Can I talk to your dance teacher to see if I can pay it over time?
No, don't. She won’t do that. If I don't get that money Ms. Yasmine says she can’t get me the application for the my scholarship
I know. I know, Elohim will make a way.  GOLDENROD REVISED 33. 33 EXT. YASMINE’S APARTMENT -NIGHT 33 Bill and Yasmine are walking down the street.
And that's how it started. I can tell you love dance.

My love is too music to have thrown back on my face.
And you remember that the next time some man tries to walk away with all your stuff.
I know that’s right. Or says I'm sorry a million times.
We all got I’m sorry stories don't we.
Get this, last week my ex came in saying,”I don’t know how she got your number baby”. I’m sorry.
No this one is it. “Oh, baby, ya know I was high. I’m sorry.” (CONTINUED)
117 GOLDENROD REVISED 94.
I’m only human, and inadequacy is what makes us human. And if we was perfect we wouldn’t have nothing to strive for. So you might as well go on and forgive me cause I’m sorry.
No this one is it. I do ya like I do ya cause I thought ya could take it. No, I’m sorry.
Now I know that you know I love ya, but I ain’t ever gonna love ya like ya want me to love ya. I’m sorry.

Shut up bitch, I told you I was sorry. All the women look at her and get serious for a second. This is the first time we notice that the women are wearing the same colors as they were in the beginning red, orange, purple, yellow, green and brown. CRYSTAL (CONT’D) It’s ok. I asked myself how I could let that happen and I realized that I was missing something. Something so important. Something promised. A laying on of hands Fingers near my forehead Strong. Cool. Moving. Makin me whole. Sense. Pure. All of God coming into me laying me open to myself. I was missing something.
Something promised.
Something free.
A laying on hands.
I know bout’ laying on bodies, laying outta man. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)
Bringing him all of my fleshy self and some of my pleasure being taken full eager wet like I get sometimes. I was missing something.
A laying on of hands.
Not a man. Laying on.
Not my Mama, holding me tight, saying I'm always gonna be her girl.
Not a laying on of a bosom and womb a laying on of hands the holiness of myself released.

I sat up one night walking my apartment floors screaming, crying. The ghost of another woman who was missing what I was missing I wanted to jump outta my bones and be done with myself. Leave me alone and go on in the wind. It was too much. I fell into a numbness til the only tree I could see took me up in her branches held me in the breeze. Made me dawn dew that chill at daybreak the sun wrapped me up swingin rose light everywhere the sky laid over me like a million men. I was cold. I was burnin up. A child and endlessly weaving garments for the moon with my tears I found God in myself and I loved her I loved her fiercely.

head_text.subj: WRITTEN ON THE SCREEN IN ALL COLORS OF THE RAINBOW

text: And this is for colored girls who have considered suicide but are moving to the ends of their own rainbows.
